definition: trusted/intimate/(of the emperor) to visit/variant of 幸[xing4]

sentences.english: It was a happy circumstance for me that Traddles came back first.
sentences.chinese: 特莱得是头一个回来的，这对我来说，真是幸事。

sentences.english: A contented mind is the greatest blessing a man can enjoy in this world.
sentences.chinese: 知足是人生在世最大的幸事。

sentences.english: And, of course, it would be a blessing for the clone itself.
sentences.chinese: 当然，这也可能是克隆本身的幸事。

sentences.english: She expressed the belief that China will achieve even greater progress in building a well-off society and a strong and prosperous China will be a blessing to Bangladesh.
sentences.chinese: 一个强大和繁荣的中国是孟加拉人民的幸事。

sentences.english: If Mr Lee the third has business acumen , fine.
sentences.chinese: 如果李在镕具有商业才干，那这是幸事。

sentences.english: Health and understanding are the two great blessing of life.
sentences.chinese: 健康和融洽是人生两大幸事。

sentences.english: Give thanks for all your blessings several times a day.
sentences.chinese: 在每一天，不止一次对你生活中的幸事表达谢意。

sentences.english: I am pleased to make your acquaintance.
sentences.chinese: 能与您了解乃是敝人之幸事。

sentences.english: Assisting these two teams in ontinuing to develop America is a real honour.
sentences.chinese: 赞助这两支队伍以促进美国足球发展实在是幸事一桩。

definition: a matter for regret/sth that is a (great) pity
the blessing of three lifetimes (idiom)/(courteous language) it's my good fortune...
no end of virtuous achievements (idiom); boundless beneficence
a matter for regret or resentment
lit. seek but fail to get (idiom); fig. exactly what one’s been looking for
refined activities of the intellectuals (regarding literature, paintings etc)
extremely rare (idiom)/once in a blue moon
